oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Appointment of Henry Deberry as sergeant in Union army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From "Commanding officer of the 52nd Regiment of Kentucky Vols," Deberry is promoted sergeant of Co. K, 52nd Ky. Inf. Regt., USA March 3, 1864. Unlike a commission, this document may also be called a warrant since the rank of sergeant is a "warrant" or non-commissioned officer. Signed by Col. J. H. Grider commanding the regiment. Company K was from Simpson County, Ky. The 52nd Ky. Inf. Regt., USA served as mounted infantry and operated against Generals Morgan and Forrest as well as guerrillas.
